data.title: NEW HOPE FOR THE DEAD - INSCRIBED TO PHILIP JOSÉ FARMER
data.meta_description: New York: St. Martin's Press, 1985. First Edition. A humorously inscribed copy of the second Hoke Moseley novel, from the collection of noted science fiction author Philip José Farmer 1918-2009 . Most likely, the authors met through Dennis McMillan, who published both of them during the 1980's. Hubin Supplement , p.127. New. Item #418 First Printing. Octavo 21.5cm ; black
data.text:
New York: St. Martin's Press, 1985. First Edition. A humorously inscribed copy of the second Hoke Moseley novel, from the collection of noted science fiction author Philip José Farmer (1918-2009). Most likely, the authors met through Dennis McMillan, who published both of them during the 1980's. Hubin (Supplement), p.127. New. Item #418

First Printing. Octavo (21.5cm); black paper-covered boards, with titles stamped in gilt on spine; dustjacket; [x],244,[2]pp. Inscribed to Philip José Farmer on the front endpaper: "To Philip José Farmer / Keep a good grip on the old sphincter, and all will be well. Yours - Charles Willeford." Spine ends gently nudged, hint of a forward lean; Near Fine. Dustjacket is unclipped (priced ($14.95), spine-sunned and lightly edgeworn; Very Good+.
